title: Synack Vulnerabilities
descriptionMarkdown: The [Synack](https://www.synack.com/solutions/vulnerability-management/) data connector provides the capability to push Synack Vulnerabilities to Sentinel.

dataTypes.name: SYNACK_VULNERABILITY
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
SYNACK_VULNERABILITY
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions on the workspace are required.

customs.name: Microsoft.Web/sites permissions
customs.description: Read and write permissions to Azure Functions to create a Function App is required. [See the documentation to learn more about Azure Functions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-functions/).

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This connector uses Azure Functions to connect to Synack to synchronize Synack Vulnerabilities to Azure Sentinel. This might result in additional data ingestion costs. Check the [Azure Functions pricing page](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/functions/) for details.

**STEP 1 - Create app registration**

 Register an application and configure it to allow contribution to Azure Sentinel

 1. **Register an application**

 From the Azure Portal, navigate to [App Registrations](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_AAD_IAM/ActiveDirectoryMenuBlade/RegisteredApps) and create new app registration. Make sure to copy the Application (client) ID. You will need it on the next step. Check [this article](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/quickstart-register-app) for details.

 2. **Grant the application permissions to Sentinel**

  To authenticate to the Sentinel Management API, grant Sentinel Contributor permissions to the application in the IAM setting of the Resource Group where Azure Sentinel has been built. Go to Resource Group -> Access control (IAM) -> Role assignments

 3. **Add client secret to the application**

 Follow [these instructions](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/quickstart-register-app#add-a-client-secret) and create client secret in the application. Make sure to copy the Value of the client secret. You will need it on the next step.

**STEP 2 - Deploy Azure Function with Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Template**

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below. 

	[![Deploy To Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](https://aka.ms/sentinel-synackdataconnector-azuredeploy)
2. Select the preferred **Subscription**, **Resource Group** and **Location**. 
3. Enter the **Workspace Name**, **Synack API URL Domain**, **Synack API token**, **Application (client) ID**, and **Client Secret**. 
4. Click **Create**.
